Reviews.Title: Good Home security
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I picked this set up last year. mounted the cameras on the eves of my house.The overlap covers part of the road and with in a month picked up pictures of the vehicleresponsible for a neighborhood break in.I picked up a second dvr and 4 cameras to completely cover the parameter of my house.You can adjust the frame rate and with motion configuration I can block out my trees moving in the wind.I set the camera pointing at the front door and gates at highest quality and the ones over looking the kidsplay structure to a lower value to save disk space.I have older kids and these camera seem to eliminate issues with coming home late.I put one in the garage and can now find when/where my tools walked off to, "teenage son".Word got out about the camera and the rift/raft now walk down a different streetIt's a better world.The only con:  if you loose power the dvr can scramble your video index and/or stop recording.I've had to unplug the cameras and restart to log in.  Then format the hard drive to get it working again.After the second time I bought a ups battery back up and plug the cameras and dvrs into this.  Nowit works even when the power goes out.I also run the provided application on my laptop at home to view saved fiels and I downloaded the android app so I can check my garage camera to make sure I really did shut the garage door.

Reviews.Title: Great features, good quality, and cost effective
Reviews.Author: Ian Houser "ianhouser"
Reviews.Content: I've used a multiple of these units in a variety of situations, and they've yet to let me down. I've even had success catching would-be thieves in the complete dark. The it's not lacking any features, and the improvements and services Swann is adding just sweeten the deal.Setup is simple enough- though I am somewhat of a techie. It includes a mouse for interaction with the UI, and you can even plug a usb keyboard in to make things easier. I've found, though, that connecting to the device on my computer and running the "NetViewer" app that is included makes setting it up way easier.New features include a dynamic dns service called "Swann DVR", free for customers, makes it much easier to open up your system outside your network for use with smartphones and web browsers wherever you might be. With a bit of port forwarding within my router, you can set it up with all your devices quite simply. Their customer service is very helpful with this as well, even taking control of your computer and configuring everything for you.The motion sensing features, along with the "night vision", make this an extremely efficient system. Just set it to only record when it senses motion (you can even specify where on screen to look, so if there's a tree that always moves or cars that go by it knows to ignore that area). This means I can just glance if there are any recordings, and if there are, I know something happened and I check it out. No more running through hours of footage just to see if something happened.The included cameras have good video quality, but if you're looking for very powerful night vision, just buy a separate camera to plug into the BNC port in the back. It's couldn't be more simple. You can even buy a "PTZ" (Pan, tilt, zoom) camera in case you want to want to control the camera wherever you are.Pros-Great quality-Great price-Good cameras-Plenty of features-Helpful supportCons-Night vision is only 33 feet with the included cameras-DVR UI can be confusingOverall it's a great unit for serious security or just peace of mind. Having one of these has already paid off over 10x what the unit cost with recovered stolen goods.

Reviews.Title: Good enough
Reviews.Author: Derek S "ds"
Reviews.Content: Have had this for about 2 weeks now, and i'm satisfied with it for the $300 paid.Pros-price-ease of setup-nice daytime video-weather resistantCons-nighttime video pretty snowy-one of the four cameras seems of less video quality than the othersOne thing I can't figure out is the motion detection setup. It seems to be recording video all the time even when set to motion capture. What's the point if it's recording all the time anyway? UPDATE: solved2ND UPDATE: Been using this setup for over a year now and it's been doing what it's supposed to.

Reviews.Title: Newly installed...So far so good
Reviews.Author: Deebo77
Reviews.Content: Most of the other reviews will give you an idea of what you are buying.  It seems to be a good unit for the money.  I use the Swann app on my Samsung Galaxy S III, not as intuitive as you'd like but it gets the job done for free.I would like to focus on some install and setup issues.For the phone app, if your DVR password is longer than 6 characters the whole password is not necessary, only enter the first 6 characters (this took forever to discover, very painful).  Also, the app/DVR only supports 4 cameras at a time for this model, so even though you get 8 cameras with this unit (2250), you can only view 4 at a time.  It's easy to switch to other cameras, but you get an error message when trying to access more than four at a time.I did set up port forwarding on my Linksys router (I ran a cat5 cable to the DVR), this enabled me to view my cameras on my desktop and will aide in setting up the more intricate details.  This .pdf helped with that process... do a google search for "swann view easy setup DVR8 I6-8500", should be the first to pop up.My wife has an I-phone/pad/pod (#ridiculous), so this should help those out there with "those" gadgets... google search "swannview for iphone"I ran all my cables through the attic, my daughter helped (small person). I connected the DVR RCA out to my 60" TV...so I can just switch the input and view my cameras if needed, no additional monitor necessary.Additionally, if all your cameras don't appear, or you see "signal lost"...you might have a power issue, try adjusting your DVR power supply setup.Finally, the manual that comes with the unit is printed poorly in black and white, many of the images are of poor quality.  Go to Swann.com, DVRs and Monitoring kits, then scroll down for the DVR8-2550...there are a few there, just find yours.I hope it helps, maybe it will save you some stress.  Best of luck!

Reviews.Title: It is true you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Carma
Reviews.Content: I decided on this product because I wanted a deter crime that has been going on in my area. I have a middle unit condo and thought this would be something good to have. The unit arrived ahead of schedule. The unit is extremly easy to install and very user friendly. The issues that people may encouter: The cameras are only good for 50 degrees of coverage and pictures are really only decent up to 20 ft.This is good for my driveway and backyard but if someone peaks over the fence, their face will not be decernable. The cameras really do not work well at night at all. The live feed seems to look pretty decent but when you go into the recordings it looks really bad. Nothing that would hold up in court. I have the system outside but may be better for inside monitoring. I think it may be on the lower end of adequate for a condo like mine but would suggest getting a better system if you have a house or need decent night time monitoring.

Reviews.Title: The DVR is the only good thing about this package.
Reviews.Author: Ameet Jayawant
Reviews.Content: Total 5 stars.1 star subtractedfor inexperienced tech support - I asked questions about PTZ and was told that the default camera did not support it. Fair enough, but what I was not told was that there is more than one way to mount and position the cameras that come with this package. This simple fyi is something that the tech support person should have known. My tech figured it out soon enough.1 star subtractedfor quality of cameras. These cameras are not fit to be used for home security. The quality is very grainy even during the day. I have mine mounted about 25 feet off the ground and can hardly see any detail.1 star subtractedfor the PC/Android software and connectivity - Internet / LAN connectivity is horrible. Login fails about half the time, and camera refresh is non-existent. I have not been able to find a y solutions online. I called tech support twice only to be told that the issue lay with my network!! They could not do any troubleshooting. I showed them the difference in latency times between their system and my ftp and media servers connected to the same subnet and they still insisted that it is my network.Add 1 star for ease of setupAdd 1 star for ease of use of software that comes installed on the dvr

Reviews.Title: Not a bad kit but terrible documentation
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I purchased this system back in October 2012, when it was the Gold Box special on Amazon.  It was purchased primarily to keep an eye on my front porch (we had some UPS packages stolen) and to track comings-and-going while we're out of town.For what we paid ($200), it's a pretty decent system.  It came with all of the essential parts -- cameras, camera mounts, cables, mounting screws, mouse, power adapter, DVR, etc.  If you're buying this system, I'd recommend that you pick up some quality wood screws (the heads snapped off the ones provided), a BNC-male to RCA-female adapter and long RCA cable (for running the output to a TV), an extension USB cable (so you can use a mouse at the TV, if the DVR is hidden), a few boxes of coax staples (for securing various wires to walls), and a backup power supply (the unit doesn't recover well from power failures).  I also bought an infrared repeater kit, so I could use the remote control at the TV (the DVR is hidden).The DVR has a surprising number of features -- motion activated recording, identifying only certain areas for motion sensitivity (handy if you don't want tree branches setting it off), the ability to access the device from a smartphone or computer running Internet Explorer (all in all, very easy to setup if your router supports UPnP, and Swann provides a free DDNS service), video/camera settings, supports different users, reboot schedules, etc.  The downside is the interface is very clunky and feels like an IT system ca. 1992.  The documentation is also pretty bad: Paragraphs will randomly end in mid sentence, you'll be referred to pages that don't exist, incorrect/inconsistent terminology is used, etc.The cameras work surprisingly well and even though the provided cables were definitely cheap, I didn't have any issues with ground loop interference or broken couplings.  The mounts are cheap but effective.  You'll just want to use your own screws, since the ones provided are incredibly fragile.If you want a kit, with everything provided, this isn't a bad system, especially if you can get it on sale.  Though, to be honest, if I were to do it all over again, I'd probably get a bare bones 8 channel DVR, buy my own hard drive, and then incrementally buy cables and cameras.  In the long run, I think it would be cheaper and easier, since I'll probably wind up upgrading the cameras and using shielded (coax) cables eventually.*****ONE YEAR UPDATE*****The system is still going strong.  I've upgraded two of the cameras to vandal proof domes with a wide angle lens and am much happier.  The cameras that come with the system, in comparison, are like looking through paper towel tubes.  For what I paid, I'm still happy with the purchase.  I did wind up running cat5 to the cameras, instead of the provided cables in order to future proof myself.  If/when this DVR dies, I'll probably go the digital route.For what this system costs now, if you're not planning on using all of the available channels right away, anyways...  Do yourself a favor and buy a higher quality DVR and one or two nice cameras, and then gradually install new cameras.  The all-in-one kits are handy but IMO, aren't really worth it when you factor in the cheap cameras, cables, and mounts.

Reviews.Title: pretty good
Reviews.Author: wildcon
Reviews.Content: Camera system works great in motion detection and the daytime picture quaility if great. My only nock is the night vision is just ok. You probably would not be able to ID anyone as the picture is too grainy. For the price, great system. If it is night vision you want, upgrade the cameras.

Reviews.Title: A good intermediate unit
Reviews.Author: Wendy & Jeff S
Reviews.Content: A lot of tech for the price (especially the Gold Value deal I got it on).A compact, stylish unit, with a mouse, and remote. 500MB hard drive that holds weeks of video (or months if you only capture movement). It's easy to install and use. The UI is attractive, but can be a bit clunky. The cameras are easily mounted and connected with the included 60' combined video/power cables. Power DOES NOT have to be available at the mounting point.I had one of these for about 6 months, but ended up selling my house, and leaving the unit behind. I replaced it with this almost identical model and it's been running non-stop for over a month.It's important to set expectations though: be aware that you're not going to get fantastic image quality. It's adequate, but not much more. I wish the cameras were a little more wide angle - they have to mounted a fair distance away if you want to cover a broad area - for example - one camera mounted in the eaves above the driveway will not capture a view of the whole driveway unless you can set them farther back.Decent quality, great value - I liked it enough to buy a second after I moved.

Reviews.Title: Second one - and died after less than 3 months
Reviews.Author: rotwylrsrgr8
Reviews.Content: I had a previous version that worked for years and then the hard drive died.  I can understand that so I ordered this item.  The first one I got wouldn't even power on, but Amazon immediately sent me a replacement with no question.Now, less than 3 months after I received the replacement - it just suddenly lost power and won't come back on.  I did the usual troubleshooting (pulling plugs, testing outlet) but still nothing.I have written an email to Swann and will see how they respond; but at this point I'm not sure I'd recommend buying this particular item.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work properly.
Reviews.Author: D. Sodders "Ohio Woodworker"
Reviews.Content: Had to send the unit back to Swann for a replacement as channel #1 didn't work. What seemed a good deal, didn't materialize.

Reviews.Title: Great Product! Even better Customer Support!
Reviews.Author: Reader1234
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice product and comes packaged well. Everything you need is included for setup right out of the box. The wiring was more than needed for me but others may have different setups so check your measurements. Their customer support is incredible, I had some problems with the more technical end of the setup (Email Alerts and Mobile feed) and they answered quickly and the staff always had an answer for my problem. Would have given 5 stars but the IR lights on one of the cameras have stopped working. Not a big deal but definitely a quality issue.

Reviews.Title: good for the money
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Tidwell
Reviews.Content: this is a very good quality for the money.  I made sure to up the image quality but had to lower the frames per second to do that.  All in all it is a good system for the money.  I had a professional install it which cost money but I was happy with the results.

Reviews.Title: Overall great item
Reviews.Author: Lauren Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: My husband installed this system about a month ago and overall, we love it! The best aspect is being able to watch from your phone (we both have iPhone 5) via the Swann app. In addition to the obvious security surveillance benefits, we have 3 of our own dogs and also foster, so we like being able to check in on the pups when we're at work or gone for the day.The only downside would be that the manual is definitely lacking and doesn't give info about functions.Good unit for the money!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Security Camera System for the Price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera security system for under $400. The system comes with a 500GB DVR, 8 security cameras, a remote control unit, a mouse, and all cables/connectors required to connect the system. The setup is very easy and the cameras provide excellent day time visibility and good night time visibility (up to 20 feet wit dim light at night). The cameras are not too big and they are not too small. You can simultaneously record up to 8 cameras on the DVR for up to 30 days in continuous recording mode - even longer in motion detection recording mode.There are (4) four ways to access and/or monitor the DVR and camera system: (1) From the console itself. (2) From the remote control unit. (3) From a computer on your home network (LAN) or a computer on the internet WAN (by installing the Swann PC software). (4) From a mobile device (Blackberry, PDA, or other mobile device that supports 3G) by downloading the Swann mobile device software. I tested all (4) methods to access the DVR and I was able to access the camera system locally (as part of a LAN) as well as over the internet using an internet computer and my mobile device (Blackberry) over the 3G network.The Swann instructions are not that good but sufficient enough if you have a basic knowledge of how to use a VCR/DVD recorder/player. The hardest part of the set up was configuring the system for remote access using my Blackberry mobile device. Since Swann does not provide step-by-step instructions on how to setup a mobile device (too many devices on the market),  I provide step-by-step instructions on how to remotely connect a Blackberry 9370 Smartphone to the Swann DVR but Amazon.com will not allow me to publish the website address of my instruction page. Therefore, I can't even tell you the website address.What I can say is that the most important parts of setting up mobile access are: (1) Ensuring that UPnP is enabled on the DVR itself (2) Enabling "Port Forwarding" on your router with the proper IP Addresses and TCP/UDP protocols (3) Identifying the correct port numbers in the router and on your mobile device. Swann Customer Support can assist you if you do not have basic computer networking knowledge (Private IP address vs Public IP Address, Port Forwarding, TCP/UDP protocols, Port addresses, etc...)The bottom line is that this product gets 5 STARS from me because it does EVERYTHING that it says it is suppose to do and it costs under $400. Viewing your video security cameras over the 3G network from anywhere in the world is completely awesome.

Reviews.Title: Works as described, Easy to use after the initial install is complete
Reviews.Author: R. Murphy
Reviews.Content: the good price with all the features I wanted caught my attention on this product, The unit works great as described and I found it easy to use (I do have a technical background) the initial install was a bit of work running all the wires in the walls (I knew this before the purchase) Night vision is poor, I'm going to set up motion lights then the night pics with outside lights on ar ok.I wasn't expectin much for the price I paid, But I feel I got my money worth and so much more! A great product for the money & I would recommend it to others (& I did)

Reviews.Title: Won't buy again
Reviews.Author: Glenn Friant "GF in IL."
Reviews.Content: Night vision stinks. Can't see hardly anything. It says night vision is good up to 33 feet but that is wrong. Also upon installation one of the cords came apart where they were seemed together. won't be buying this kind again.

Reviews.Title: Great starter set for security, lots of features
Reviews.Author: Andy Goin "Take it easy"
Reviews.Content: This is our first security cam setup for the exterior of our home and we ran the cables and installed it ourselves no problem.  The cables hooked up securely and the system worked perfectly when we powered it on.  Getting it only and the ability for us to view via our Smartphones (iPhones in this case) took a slight bit of networking and computer knowledge but we were able to get that working no problems also.The cameras are good entry level cameras it seems, they have good quality during the day and decent quality at night, the limiting factor seems to be distance at night and there is room for improvement on the clarity of the cameras overall, but for the price, we were quite surprised with the package overall.  No complaints.We hooked the system up to an older monitor we have, no issues there, no keyboard support means you're entering text using an on screen keyboard and the mouse, but it's not a big deal.  No wifi built in means you're running a networking cable to your router, which in our case wasn't an issue either.We use the system to monitor our vehicles out front, the two sides of the house, and the backyard to keep an eye on the boys when they play and for our needs, the product works great and gives us ideas on upgrading in the future.  We do wish the cameras were more clear, we wish the nightvision was better although it does work wonderfully at watching the car at night, and the lack of wifi may be a turn off for some, but we enjoy it and give it 4 stars out of 5.

Reviews.Title: Cameras dont last
Reviews.Author: Johnathan Stein
Reviews.Content: I have had this system up for about 4 months now and 6 of the 8 cameras have lost the night vision capabilities. I own a bar and grill and there are a couple of instances that I have needed to review events that happened and cannot since the night vision is no longer working. Very disappointed. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: SWANN DVR
Reviews.Author: Adrian
Reviews.Content: VERY GOOD SYSTEM GOOD PIC NIGHT AND DAY BEST THING I EVER GOT FOR THE PRICE FAST SHIPING EASY TO INSTALL

Reviews.Title: 4 camera system
Reviews.Author: Adam P. Layton
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera system for my parents office.  The DVR displayed in the pictures was not the DVR i received.  The picture quality of the cameras arent really that great by any means.  The Swann android app is a little glitchy and likes to erase the camera configuration every other time i tried to use it.  Overall, my parents are satisfied with the cameras because it lets them see people walking into the office without having the get up.  Ive never purchased any other camera systems before and I will be trying a different brand next time i am in need of another system.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY FROM SWANN
Reviews.Author: Chris F.
Reviews.Content: Bought an 8 channel unit. Had problems from the start. BAD DVR and BAD CAMERAS. ONLINE SUPPORT WAS WORTHLESS, CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE, AND REFUSED TO RESPOND TO EMAILS.  HIGHLY RECOMEND NOT BUYING FROM SWANN!!!

Reviews.Title: Was this a bait and switch?
Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: Was not the unit shown on box. I tried to get what I wanted a second time, but that shipment too had the wrong DVR unit in the box. Both RETURNED

Reviews.Title: Great security system
Reviews.Author: Tony Brummett
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews for security systems and all have a lot of negatives.  But my personal experience with this one has been fantastic.  I opened the box, plugged everything in.  I used and old TV I had lying around and it has been working great.  I plsn on getting the 8 camera unit for an out building on the property.  I am using 2 units inside and 2 units outside under a covered porch, so they are not exposed to a lot of weather.  I also only use this unit to record, I have never tried the internet functions and have no need for them.  The screens are very clear and you can easily identify someone.  Been using this for about 1 year.

Reviews.Title: Great low cost surveillance
Reviews.Author: kcjames
Reviews.Content: Since buying one of these, I've now put in 3 different systems at different locations.  Everybody has loved this product.  It's Mac friendly, iPhone / iPad friendly and works great.  Easy to look back at past events from a computer, and to look at your cameras no matter where you are at.

Reviews.Title: Didn't Last Long
Reviews.Author: Lobo
Reviews.Content: I have had this product less than a year and the disk drive has already broken.  It's been a long drawn out process communicating with Australia to get it replaced.  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Good, but not the best Swann Product
Reviews.Author: BoxyBrown
Reviews.Content: This is a very solid CCTV system, it comes with everything needed to record 24/7 on a black box like looping system that requires absolutely no maintenance unless you need to review the footage.I have two major gripes about this item1. The mounting system on the more expensive model looks much more professional. This Swann system mounts to a wall, then requires you to drill a hole for the camera wires to go through to the DVR. On the model I purchased for my mom (unfortunately I forget the model number, but I know it was Swann.) You actually drilled a quarter inch hole in the mounting surface, then screwed the camera into the mounting surfaces, and the camera wiring went from the camera mount to the dvr. The big advantage here is that it looks way more professional, and that there are NO EXPOSED WIRES. With the method this camera system uses you're going to have exposed wires and require some grommets to fill the holes you just drilled in your house/business.2. The night vision is horrible compared to the more expensive IR model.These two reasons alone make me wish I had purchased the same model as I got for my mom. I actually meant to purchase that one but didn't realize the difference in model number until too late.Still a solid system though, and I use it for my own home.

Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: Ruger
Reviews.Content: The Cameras are pretty weak. Tech support I'll give a 8 because most of you will need to call to set up the Internet access. All in all it is an awesome system. I would buy it again and my friend got one on my recommendation. If you "need" a rebate from Swann forget about it! They still owe me $100 bucks from 1-2013. I never got one rebate I was owed from this company. Missing at least 4. I lost count! I also would not buy it from anywhere but Amazon just in case I had to return it. I once tried to return something to Swann that turned into a BBB complaint. The Internet portion is great!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: sherri perkins
Reviews.Content: works for what we needed it for would like to have a wider span on it. but all in all its a good product

Reviews.Title: Security
Reviews.Author: Zuzu
Reviews.Content: An entry level security device.  I chose it because of its value for price.  I checked out the reviews first.

Reviews.Title: Swan does not make a reliable product
Reviews.Author: FishTech
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Swan security camera system about between 1 to 2 years ago.  I didn't buy it from Amazon but these systems are available from local lumber yards and various online retailers.  My experience is 2 cameras went bad and then one of the camera ports on the unit went bad causing the sequential operation of going from one camera to another to malfunction as well.  Camera quality is poor, identifying people doesn't work as well as I'd hoped it would, and like I said, two camera failed due to moisture and both were mounted under the overhang of the roof.  Now that the recording unit port malfunctioned I will certainly never buy another Swan system again.  I'm now looking for a replacement system with cameras that work a longer distances with better resolution and better night vision as well.  Wish me luck or respond with a system that has worked well for you over several years.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working in 30 days
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: System stopped working one month after running it. Worked great for the first month then just stopped. The night vision was very poor on this model, very weak or no image beyond 5 feet.

Reviews.Title: It does the basics, but...
Reviews.Author: Big Spender
Reviews.Content: The control software is not at all user friendly.  My biggest gripe is that it doesn't allow you to scan the alarm log (motion detect events)  for a specific camera or a time period.  So you are forced to start at the beginning (or end) of a possibly large log for a certain day, and  shuffle through it by clicking "next" (or "previous"), 8 entries at a time.  There is no indication in the log for the camera that caused the alarm, so you have to look at them all.Another example  of poor design decisions is in the interplay of "full time" and "alarm only" video recording.  If a busy camera is set to record all the time during the day, and then only on alarm (motion) events after hours, you still get many many alarm events in the log during the day.  And these are mixed in with alarm events from other cameras that are only operated by motion.  It makes it hard to scan the log for meaningful events from these alarm-only cameras.  It would have been much better if the logging of alarm events during "full time" recording was a user choice.  Even just identifying the camera causing the alarm (see above) would have helped.In one situation, the control software is really clumsy.  If you are setting up a camera to record on a schedule, you select "schedule mode" on the "recording" screen for the  camera, and then select "schedule" to actually set up the schedule". Even though you may have been configuring camera 3, you are always presented with the schedule for camera 1.  You must select camera 3 again.  I have mistakenly set the schedule for camera 1 on more than one occasion.  Not a big deal, and it was my fault because I didn't pay close enough attention.  It just is not intuitive. even though everything is labelled.On the other hand, the connection to the time server is easy to set up.  The time server is absolutely necessary because the internal clock drifts.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Swann
Reviews.Author: andy999
Reviews.Content: Very excellent product and good service.recommend this product .love it will buy again.anytime u need Swann service they will help u n guide u all the way,

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with iPad
Reviews.Author: Bob C "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Works well as a security system. It doesn't work with some internet browsers like Safari Power PC versions but most seriously it doesn't work with iPad. The Swannview Pro seems to work with iPhone but I am not the first to find it doesn't work with iPad. Stay away from Swann if you have an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: LEGIBUS LIVES! "I AM LEGIBUS & LEGIBUS LIVES!"
Reviews.Content: I've only hooked up one of the camera's but it works great. I had it set up so it would send an e-mail via text to my cell phone when something would change on screen to detect if there was a burglar in the house when I went on vacation. It is really sensitive even though the sensitivity was turned all the way down. It would send me a picture and if I saw something worth reporting, I could call the police immediately and have them respond even though I was in another state. I just didn't like the fact that the wires were exposed so I bought another swann camera with a protected wire to post outside of the home after drilling a hole through my concrete wall. Only problem is the infrared shines too bright on anyone directly in front of the camera and I haven't been able to reduce this to get better footage. Overall, it's a good system.

Reviews.Title: Not too good
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: The recorder work well and is easy to set up.  The only problem is the cameras.  They say it can see in the dark with a range of up to 32 feet.  Try 1/3  (10 feet) of this and it must be in total darkness.  With the cameras set up I could not see a thing when the room was faintly lit.  I thought the cameras were broken and called tech support.  They were willing to exchange them but then I had an idea.  I had a remote monitor that could hook into the camera and took it into a dark closet and powered it up. I could see really good, but only about 10 feet.  Considering the camera would be mounted about 8 to 10 feet up, how far do you think it could see? Then if even a small light was present the IR illumination would go off and there would be no night vision.  I think the IR sensor is too sensitive and no range in darkness.

Reviews.Title: great system
Reviews.Author: Mathew Thommy
Reviews.Content: this is a great system for a great price. I had this setup for my fathers store and it has become very helpful to him when anything occurs. very user friendly and great quality cameras. It can be used for indoors and outdoors.

Reviews.Title: poor service, Swann doesnt back produt
Reviews.Author: KH
Reviews.Content: A couple years back I purchased 2 Swann DVR 8 at Costco costing $2200.  Shortly after Swann released a whole new product line.  Now that I upgraded to Windows 7 my system is basically non functional.  I will say I had no product complaints when my system was running on older windows platform.  I spent over 3 hours between on hold, and  Swann tech support to no avail, and Swann sales wouldnt offer so much as a discount on new product.  Swann advertises "lifetime support" which is obviously not the case!  I am not going to invest anymore money into Swann products because who knows if it will work properly with next generation windows pc's?  So buyer, please be aware and research before purchasing.

Reviews.Title: easy to setup if you work for Swann
Reviews.Author: Sloan
Reviews.Content: I've futz with this thing for months.  The IR illuminators gave out 2 months in.  It will send the test alert email but won't send an email when motion is detected which I know works because it will generate the beep beep beep.  I've never been able to get it to record to the hard drive and the web interface doesn't allow you access to reformat it.  Next time I'm at the thrift store I might be able to find an LCD monitor from 1990 that will work this this one so I can try to directly connect to it.  I'd spent 3x more if it actually worked as designed.  I've put 40 hours into trying to get this thing to work over the last months as a not-so-fun-project and it's going in the trash on Tuesday.  I may run over the cameras with my truck just to feel better before I toss them out.

Reviews.Title: Sudden problems
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "SandyPandy"
Reviews.Content: I picked this system because of the great reviews given but now my device is giving me problems. After 6 months of usage the device no longer wants to record and it turns off and on by itself taking up to 40mins to come back. I already contacted the company and Im hoping they can fix it.

Reviews.Title: Difference in the ducks.
Reviews.Author: nitejoker
Reviews.Content: I bought this DVR combo to use for paranormal research so that we would be able to cover larger areas with eight cameras. The DVR hiccupped the first time we used it and we lost over 30 hours of video because the DVR reset itself. I went back in the setup and worked out the bugs so the DVR is fine just remember to do a dry with before using it for anything else. The cameras that came with the DVR are crap. The IR doesn't come on when in complete darkness. The video is clear during the daytime only. If the DVR is available by itself get it and don't worry about the combo packages.

Reviews.Title: satisfied costumer
Reviews.Author: Dana Hagan
Reviews.Content: To tell the  truth it is all it said it would be I put 1upgrade camera and at night iit is great.The ones that come with it work better then expected for the money  GOOD!

Reviews.Title: Good but not great at nigth
Reviews.Author: M. Dominguez "Stitch"
Reviews.Content: these cameras are good, can't really see the faces in too detail from afar but up close it's good.Easy setup At night it's horrible, very snowy

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Mr.Hiatt
Reviews.Content: Nice complete system. Cameras aren't the best quality but reasonable for the price. I had one camera that actually didn't work. Called swann and they authorized and paid for the return and sent a replacement with no problem.  You'd be hard pressed to find better for the cost. Remote viewing is practically non functional so don't get excited for that.

Reviews.Title: Nice smooth working DVR
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I install these systems for my clients all the time. I never have a problem with the products for the great tech support they offer for free on their products. Friendly easy to understand people you got there at Swann

Reviews.Title: does the job intended for
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: not bad for the money. tech help is great. they seem to know what your asking and have the answer. the zoom feature is hard to figure out and when figured out is pretty much useless seeing as theres no adjustment so it just zooms in and blows the picture up so much that you cant make anything out. day vision with resolution set to max and connected to 1080p tv is good. night, well you can see but you cant make out any ones face after 25'. but then this isnt a $800.00 setup. does the job and worth the money. real easy to install.

Reviews.Title: Great system for an even better price!
Reviews.Author: ahoffoss
Reviews.Content: For the money and the price you can not beat this system!  I bought this as a backup unit for my other system and it's worked perfectly when I've needed it to.  The camera are nothing special, but if purchased separately would cost around $50 ea.  The system pretty much pays for itself!

Reviews.Title: This is well worth what you spend
Reviews.Author: Linda stafford
Reviews.Content: we started out with 1 camera from Wal-Mart of this brand and was so impressed with the performance that we ordered the whole kit with the DVR

Reviews.Title: Best system EVER!!!
Reviews.Author: M T. Landry
Reviews.Content: I had installed and set this system up a couple of times. So, when we decided to get a system for our own home, This was the logical choice. It's easy to set up, has remote computer access and mobile access. Swann customer support if you have a problem or question is friendly and knowledgeable. I recommend this brand to anyone who needs security for their home or business.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: This thing rocks.  The motion sensor notification is a bit sensitive unless you place them perfectly.  I got about 200 emails the first night I enabled this feature.  Besides that, this thing has great value.  Cameras always work and I can check in through my mobile phone whenever I want.

Reviews.Title: Good price, fair cameras
Reviews.Author: Hank
Reviews.Content: I can't add too much to a lot of good reviews.  I have been using the system for about four months.  I find you get good value for the money on a basic system.  Here are a few problems I have found:1) When first turning on & testing the system I had no video on the VGA monitor and was totally stuck, hidden in the manual I finally found you have to hold a button for three seconds to switch to VGA.2) When setting up accounts for remote viewing you have to have administer privilege.  I cannot set up my kids i-phones or my parents devices to just view as a restricted user.3) Cameras are okay in light, but poor in low light.  Close up, such as inside in the dark you can make out and possibly identify a person.  They are very poor in the dark outside, very snowy and nearly impossible to see anything more than ten feet away.4) The manual was not clear nor helpful at all for more difficult things setting up email and alarm notifications5) Don't try to set it up using the remote PC Swanview app as it has limited functionality, use the mouse & monitor on the DVR itself.  The thing that got me was that I couldn't see which camera was triggering the motion recording as it doesn't show up on Swannview.  Once I looked on the DVR it marked the offending camera with a M (for motion), then I could adjust the sensitivity6) Amazon has removed the free Swannview app for Kindle.  Before I bought this system I checked & it was there, after I bought the system it disappeared and links you to some "IP Cam Viewer" for $3.99.  If you have a Kindle Fire you can go to Google apps and do a round-a-bout install and get the better free Swann app, but if you have a base Kindle you are stuck.Things that I liked:1) Tech support was fast, friendly and very helpful.2) Learning how to set up recording modes was fairly easy3) DNS setup was easy and free through Swann4) I can add better cameras as I can afford them, but for now I have the system up and running.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for price
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Willis
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price. Cams can be upgraded. I have already upgraded one of my cams for a better night vision cam buyt overall very satisfied

Reviews.Title: 8 channel cameras
Reviews.Author: K. Colvin
Reviews.Content: Awesome security systems. I will look for a wireless cameras and security system. If I would be told about a wireless control cameras I could have gotten those.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: J. Guerrero "jagged"
Reviews.Content: it is a little difficult to setup the port forwarding for the mobile and online access to work. google your service provider or router to see if its Upnp. Once you get it setup you'll really enjoy checking in on things! and good luck in your attic!

Reviews.Title: All good!
Reviews.Author: JJDR
Reviews.Content: Been using this kit for more than six months, the resolution is not great but it does the job, it is very easy to set up and the OS is easy to use, I calculate that it records up to three weeks back. I have it on 24/7.

Reviews.Title: Great cameras and DVR
Reviews.Author: Ray562
Reviews.Content: Swann DVR's are very good and  I haven't found any camera that wont work with it. I usually add better cameras as needed to my  security system.

Reviews.Title: works good so far
Reviews.Author: jess
Reviews.Content: Was easy to install. Can see what is going on from my phone.  Detects motion so you are not stuck watching hours worth of nothing! will update again in a few months

Reviews.Title: exactly what i needed
Reviews.Author: ignacio
Reviews.Content: very easy to install, even to configure mobile access and remote pc access.images are not cristal clear...if you need to recognize faces at over 3 feet from camera, then you should look for another product... i use these camaras to check on my children while i'm at work and they are great for that!

Reviews.Title: Best buy for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Stan Fornal
Reviews.Content: Exellent!!!!!!!!!!! easy to install. Great tech support. Works very well. I would recommend this system to everyone. Very good image as well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: gone_down
Reviews.Content: Excellent product and incredible picture even in night vision.  Clarity is phenomenal and far above why i expected and some of the best I've ever seen from a reasonable prices system with 8 yrs in LE seen a few in my day and this is high grade equipment

Reviews.Title: I enjoyed the product!
Reviews.Author: Aj
Reviews.Content: These cameras are great for the application I needed them for. I give this set up a four star review.

Reviews.Title: Daytime resolution not quite good enough to read a license plate from 10 feet, night time resolution could be better
Reviews.Author: Donnallyrk
Reviews.Content: Pros:-Inexpensive relative to similiar options-Truly all weather-Easy to self install (I did not need to snake cables through any walls)-Easy to figure out software-Acceptable resolution (for my needs - detecting and recording any activity within the field of view)Cons:-Camera resolution may not satisfy everyone's needs (cannot read license plates from 10 feet, but perfectly suitable for monitoring activity at 50+ feet)-Software is quite outdated-Searching the archived video is a chore - easy to figure out, but not quick or convenient to use.-Power cord is exposed and can be cut easilyOther comments:-I have not connect the Internet to they DVR so I cannot speak to that function

Reviews.Title: Great product for our use!
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: We are using it in our kids room at church because it has some enclosed playhouse areas and we wanted to be able to keep an eye on the kids.

Reviews.Title: Easy Install and Great Customer Support
Reviews.Author: Dorsey Holsinger
Reviews.Content: The delivery time was better than expected. All the necessary components were there. It did not take long to install. The worst part is running the wires through the internal roof area. Instructions were easy to follow. So far, it is working very well.

Reviews.Title: Good system for the price
Reviews.Author: Stephanie W.
Reviews.Content: Installed the system 2 days ago, and seems to be doing good. The IR at night seem to work well, one camera is in a 12x12 office, and with the lights off at night you can still see the whole room. Record space seems good, I let the four cameras record constant for 24 hours, and the HDD still had 306 hours of space left on it, so with the cameras set up on motion record it should double the space.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup
Reviews.Author: Amber Brostrom
Reviews.Content: Feel safe and secure. The set up was easy too! A must for any small business wanting to have that extra security.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Tino Sinapi
Reviews.Content: easy to use, great set up, beautiful cameras.  Highly recommended.  I will use this again.  I have set up cameras for various businesses, these are the best bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: Security system
Reviews.Author: BRENT MULLEN
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Swann 4-channel system 2 years ago. The system itself is great but I do regret not buying a 8-channel system. I replaced the 4 cameras & got the night owl cameras in place. The cameras that came with this system are good during the day but not very good at night. For the price its not a bad system

Reviews.Title: Swann 8
Reviews.Author: William J. Whelan "60's revolutionary"
Reviews.Content: This DVR 8 set up is everything as advertised. I especially liked the Tech Support as they were able to install the software no problem, and easily walked my through until everything was up and running on computer and my i Phone.I love it!

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Juan M Garcia
Reviews.Content: It is a great value they work as expected.  The internet viewing set up is complicated, but the technical support is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Great security system
Reviews.Author: Owen Lau
Reviews.Content: I was first attracted by it's price.  Setup was easy, cameras are cleared.  Playback is smooth.  Face recognizable at 10 feet against direct sunlight.  I'm real happy with the purchase.  The system will be used in a small pharmacy for theft deterrent.

Reviews.Title: A great product!
Reviews.Author: R. Hoyer "RH"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this product when Amazon had it on their Gold Box.  It is quite a deal for $199.  The setup of the DVR and cameras was quite easy along with the initial configuration.  Swann recommends that you use a router with uPnP (Plug and Play) configuration, but provides for routers that do not have this configuration.  I am in an all Apple environment with an Apple Extreme Router, Macintosh computer, with iPhone and iPad.  The Apple Extreme does not have uPnP included, so I was concerned.  It requires that it be configured with port forwarding  and the Apple Extreme does not support this mode.  The configuration is far from simple and I would call it very complex.One of the best things about this Swann system is their support.  On the Amazon site it says that "Excellent" support is provided, and indeed that is the case.  I certainly give them five stars for their support and more!  They were able to log on to my Macintosh computer remotely and assist with the configuration of Safari on the computer, the configuration of all the port forwarding on the router, and final configuration necessary for the DVR itself.I would say that they included documentation is less than satisfactory.  It would be nice to have a step by step process for the setup and configuration for the internet.  But the lack of adequate documentation is more than made up by their super telephone support.  I would certainly recommend that if you get one of these units, that you do the basic set up and then call for assistance with the computer, router, and DVR configuration.  It will save you a lot of grief.I would now say that this would have been a good product at the regular price on Amazon and it was only better because I happened to find it on their Gold Box deals.So YES, it does work in an Apple environment with all apple equipment.  I presume that there is no problem with a pc and windows setup, but apple is always a little more problematic with outside vendors.By the way, the DVR is quite simple to use and does a good job with the pictures.  I only rate this product down to 4 stars because I think they could do a better job with documentation.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value in a Well Designed System
Reviews.Author: Jamie Ratliff
Reviews.Content: I have used Lorex DVR's for years, a well known brand of security camera equipment. Recently this DVR was featured as a Gold Box Deal, and since I was in the market for a new DVR, I decided to give the Swann brand a try. I have been very pleased with the system. Many people just want a set and forget it DVR system that has an easy to use web interface. This Swann DVR fits the need very well. First, the web interface is intuitive and makes it easy to search, playback, and download video. The system also allows you to use a smartphone to view the camera system. Swann has a few apps available for Android and iOS, and there are numerous independent apps that work well with this DVR, including IP Cam Viewer. The video image is pretty good quality, and well enough for most people. Let's be honest, if you are looking for a high-end security system that would rival military grade, you won't find it here, but if you need a good system that delivers quality video recording, that is easy to setup, and easy to view remotely via web browser or smartphone, than the Swann DVR system is a very good match and affordable as well.

Reviews.Title: Very low quality and poor on options.
Reviews.Author: FSX
Reviews.Content: This was a very bad buy, the quality of the cameras are super bad. These were cmos although stated ccd on the site. After complaining they put it. You won't be able to recognize any faces. The cameras don't have a decent wide angle and they are all zoomed in so you will be watching only about 10 square feet. No options such as email notifications when detecting motion, zooming etc... Again, VERY BAD!!!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: System worked great during daylight. 2 cameras had to be sent back due to the night vision was not working.

Reviews.Title: Connected very quickly and after alitle attic work it is installed and working great.
Reviews.Author: G. Smith
Reviews.Content: Tech support was readily available and knew when to turn over to the experts.  After acouple calls it is on the internet for me to view on my smart phone.  Clarity is great in daylight somewhat hazy with night vision.  Meets my need and works great.Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Swann 8 camera home video surveillance system
Reviews.Author: Bootsy
Reviews.Content: The cameras and DVR were easy to install-- once I'd figured out placement! The night vision works well but the active field is narrower. Beware siting in view of heater or dryer outlets, because at night the hot air shows up as "smoke" causing mild panic initially!Setting up the mobile app was very difficult but fortunately my son is a software engineer. In particular the written instructions are not clear on the fact that at least two DVR versions  are being supplied, one has a "Mobile" setting and may be a simpler setup, the other does not, and requires "Port forwarding" (whatever that is! )All in all, I am delighted to have an 8 camera system for $401 and a monitor for $95. Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: excellent in day light cameras no good at night
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Cameras aree excellent in day light and night can see nothing. DVR records ral nice. Simple to setup shame about the cameras could see nothing out side at night. I have a DVR system from Harbor Freight can see around 50 feet at night records real nice thought this would also needed a 8 camera for new house I am purchasing will keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Swann Camera System Great Product and Service!
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Cruz
Reviews.Content: I bought this set of camera's under the recommendation of a friend of mine from California. He told me what good service and product it is. I want everyone to know that I am very happy with this system. I live in Cumming, Georgia and I view my other property in Nova Scotia, Canada from my computer and from my android phone with this system. Also I want everyone to know about the great service from the help desk. They helped me install this system on my computer and on my android phone. It does not matter who you talk to in the help desk they are all fantastic and knowledgeable. I recommend the Swann camera system very highly for the product and the backup service from the help desk! I am planning to buy a 8 channel camera system from Swann to upgrade my existing system!Thank you!Richard

Reviews.Title: Great for watching the pool.
Reviews.Author: Edsel Buglar "Man of mystery."
Reviews.Content: I don't actualy have a pool but my neighbor does. His daughters and their freinds making all that noise is very suspicious so I make sure to monitor them every time they are at the pool. I don't care what the restraining order says.At night, I watch the tapes to make sure I didn't miss anything illegal going on over there. I know there must be something going on over there. While else would the father threaten me every time he catches me peeking through the hole in the fence?

Reviews.Title: Don't purchase....
Reviews.Author: Yvette Washington
Reviews.Content: Installed 5 of the 8 camera's outside my home. Connecting to the internet was very convoluted process.. All camera's has very poor night vision with a lot of interference. (A Lot of Interference) It's very hard to make out who, what is captured on the camera's. If I had the original boxes, I would be sending the system back for a refund. I previously had a NIghtOwl system at my old home and it worked very well, but I thought I would try to upgrade to a more advance system and this was the worst. I would not recommend this Swann system to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Haven't installed it yet, but...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love the look of the security system. I cannot wait to use it!Four cameras will take care of what I need!Fast shipping!!

Reviews.Title: CAMERAS
Reviews.Author: R. THORNE "rthorne"
Reviews.Content: MY HUSBAND IS EXTREMELY HAPPY WITH THIS SWANN SECURITY CAMERA SYSTEM. THE VIEWS FROM THE CAMERAS ARE VERY CLEAR AND HE FOUND IT EASY TO ASSEMBLE HIMSELF.

Reviews.Title: really bad
Reviews.Author: sem
Reviews.Content: i did not liked the item.the camera if to rate from 1-10 will be a 1 (really bad quality)

Reviews.Title: So good I bought a second set!
Reviews.Author: Thomas Coster
Reviews.Content: Having cameras for many decades I can tell you that not long ago you would have paid multi-thousands of dollars for a similar system.

Reviews.Title: Too complicated to set up
Reviews.Author: Alexis Haglin Richert "Lexiepd"
Reviews.Content: We are returning thus product because it is too complicated!  My husband who is quite the Technical Savy guy looked over the 75 page boom of instructions and said "no way!"Also, it only works with fast Internet connections and we bought it to help us look over our place in the country when we couldn't be there - which of course has slow Internet connections because it is in the "boonies"

Reviews.Title: YEAH
Reviews.Author: THEANGELSHAVETAKENTHEPHONEBOOTH
Reviews.Content: PERFECT FOR THE RECREATION OF EVERY PARANORMAL ACTIVITY MOVIE. MADE ME LAUGH> EASY TO ASSEMBLE AND GOOD QUALITY. I ENJOY IT A LOT.

Reviews.Title: a little too clear
Reviews.Author: Brian McGrath the Carny
Reviews.Content: Greetings fellow amazonians its been really slow out here at the carnival in eureka, nv this week so I have been upgrading my trailer with some recent purchases. I decided to set this up after my last security system had been destroyed by mongo running it over with his rascal. I felt that in a town like eureka with about 20 people here I wouldn't need it, but who knows where I will be next week and then it might be too late. Anyhoo installation was successful and easy. I couldn't wait to try it out and through out the day I sat and watched; swiching cameras and seeing people come and go. Then as night fell I noticed something peculiar. There was someone dancing in what appeared to be a horsehead and loin cloth around my trailer. He started on camera two then moved to three, back to two and finally stopped at one. There he stood staring into my camera with his dead horse head eyes. It creaped me out I had to get away from the screen. I tried looking outside but it was too dark to see and mongo and eugene went into town to celebrate the annoucement of a new star wars movie. I went back to the tv screen and the horse head man was gone from camera one. I started flipping through the cameras and he was on camera four so close to it that all you could make out was one giant eye! I started freaking out how was I going to get out of here; I quickly called the police. As soon as they heard I was from the carnival and that a man with a horse head was stalking me they just laughed and hung up the phone on me. right now I am hiding under the bed and I can hear the horse head man walking on top of my trailer. If I make it out of here alive I will let you know....

View & record 4 channels of high quality video simultaneously in real time
Includes 4 weather resistant, clear resolution 400TVL cameras with powerful night vision to 33ft/10m
Set & forget by recording continuously from 4 cameras for 120 days+ onto a massive 500GB hard drive, even longer with motion detection
Surveillance in the palm or your hand with live viewing on 3G enabled Smartphone including iPhone, iPad, Android, BlackBerry, Windows Mobile 6, Symbian OS and more*, with remote notification via email
Save time & have peace of mind by easily locating incident video, then transfer to USB flash drive
